oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of Pvt. John Herman Uhles, Co. K, 109th Inf. Regt., 28th Div.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. Herman Uhles, Co. K, 109th Inf. Regt., 28th Div. was born December 12, 1889 in Gordonsville, Smith County, Tennessee. He moved to Madera, California and worked as a teamster. He was drafted from California and placed in a machine gun company. He was sent overseas as a replacement and reassigned to the infantry. He received wounds to both legs and died July 28, 1918. His original burial was in Aisne, France but he was reinterred near Elmwood, Smith County, Tennessee in 1921.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Uhles, John Herman
World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
